intro: Demorchis khangii, commonly known as the Korean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers well-drained soil. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
